intro: Oenothera ammophiloides var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, angular stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. This variety is distinguished by its narrower foliage compared to other varieties of Oenothera ammophiloides.
